intro: Juniperus cosnino, commonly known as the Cosnino juniper, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae and is characterized by its needle-like leaves and small, berry-like cones. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces aromatic foliage and is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and ornamental value. The cones of Juniperus cosnino are typically dark blue to black in color and contain toxic seeds.
